20110118140021.937|20110118140023.874|TR0|
20110118140023.874|20110118140025.811|TR0|Tunisian Leader Ousted in Mass 
20110118140025.811|20110118140027.749|TR0|Uprising; Protesters Denounce 
20110118140027.749|20110118140029.686|TR0|Old Guard in New Gov't
20110118140029.686|20110118140031.623|TR0|
20110118140031.623|20110118140033.561|TR0|Tunisia has announced an interim 
20110118140033.561|20110118140035.498|TR0|national unity government days 
20110118140035.498|20110118140037.435|TR0|after a popular revolt ousted 
20110118140037.435|20110118140039.373|TR0|President Zine El Abidine Ben 
20110118140039.373|20110118140041.310|TR0|Ali. In what's been called the 
20110118140041.310|20110118140043.247|TR0|first Middle East revolution 
20110118140043.247|20110118140045.185|TR0|since 1979, Ben Ali fled Tunisia 
20110118140045.185|20110118140047.122|TR0|on Friday after a month of 
20110118140047.122|20110118140049.059|TR0|unprecedented protests. 
20110118140049.059|20110118140050.997|TR0|Thousands took to the streets to 
20110118140050.997|20110118140052.934|TR0|rally against unemployment, high 
20110118140052.934|20110118140054.871|TR0|food prices, corruption and 
20110118140054.871|20110118140056.809|TR0|state repression. At least 80 
20110118140056.809|20110118140058.746|TR0|people were killed in a 
20110118140058.746|20110118140100.683|TR0|government crackdown. On Monday, 
20110118140100.683|20110118140102.621|TR0|Tunisian Prime Minister Mohamed 
20110118140102.621|20110118140104.558|TR0|Ghannouchi announced members of 
20110118140104.558|20110118140106.495|TR0|opposition parties will hold 
20110118140106.495|20110118140108.433|TR0|government positions for the 
20110118140108.433|20110118140110.370|TR0|first time. But key figures of 
20110118140110.370|20110118140112.307|TR0|the old guard - including the 
20110118140112.307|20110118140114.245|TR0|former defense, foreign, 
20110118140114.245|20110118140116.182|TR0|interior and finance ministers - 
20110118140116.182|20110118140118.119|TR0|will keep their posts in the new 
20110118140118.119|20110118140120.057|TR0|government. Up to 1,000 
20110118140120.057|20110118140121.994|TR0|protesters took to the streets 
20110118140121.994|20110118140123.931|TR0|on Monday in protest and called 
20110118140123.931|20110118140125.869|TR0|for the exclusion of all members 
20110118140125.869|20110118140127.806|TR0|of the Ben Ali government.
20110118140127.806|20110118140129.743|TR0|
20110118140129.743|20110118140131.681|TR0|Protester: "We are not expecting 
20110118140131.681|20110118140133.618|TR0|anything from these criminals. 
20110118140133.618|20110118140135.555|TR0|Their laws are made with the 
20110118140135.555|20110118140137.493|TR0|blood of the Tunisians. They are 
20110118140137.493|20110118140139.430|TR0|liars, they are assassins, they 
20110118140139.430|20110118140141.367|TR0|are criminals. Can you trust a 
20110118140141.367|20110118140143.305|TR0|liar, the one who has been 
20110118140143.305|20110118140145.242|TR0|supporting a dictator? We don't 
20110118140145.242|20110118140147.179|TR0|want them anymore. If they don't 
20110118140147.179|20110118140149.117|TR0|understand, what language do we 
20110118140149.117|20110118140151.054|TR0|have to use?"
20110118140151.054|20110118140152.991|TR0|
20110118140152.991|20110118140154.929|TR0|The protests that led to Ben 
20110118140154.929|20110118140156.866|TR0|Ali's overthrow gained momentum 
20110118140156.866|20110118140158.803|TR0|last month after unemployed 
20110118140158.803|20110118140200.741|TR0|university graduate Mohamed 
20110118140200.741|20110118140202.678|TR0|Bouazizi set himself on fire. He 
20110118140202.678|20110118140204.615|TR0|died earlier this month. The 
20110118140204.615|20110118140206.553|TR0|self-immolation has led to 
20110118140206.553|20110118140208.490|TR0|apparent copycat protests in 
20110118140208.490|20110118140210.427|TR0|other North African states, with 
20110118140210.427|20110118140212.365|TR0|four men setting themselves on 
20110118140212.365|20110118140214.302|TR0|fire in Algeria and one each in 
20110118140214.302|20110118140216.239|TR0|Egypt and Mauritania.

20110118140239.487|20110118140241.424|TR0|to San Diego, California, within

20110118140304.672|20110118140306.610|TR0|Accused Arizona shooter Jared 
20110118140306.610|20110118140308.547|TR0|Loughner's former college 
20110118140308.547|20110118140310.484|TR0|meanwhile has released a home 
20110118140310.484|20110118140312.422|TR0|video of his in which he tours 
20110118140312.422|20110118140314.359|TR0|Pima Community College at night. 
20110118140314.359|20110118140316.296|TR0|The video was first posted to 
20110118140316.296|20110118140318.234|TR0|YouTube in September. In these 
20110118140318.234|20110118140320.171|TR0|excerpts, Loughner refers to the 
20110118140320.171|20110118140322.108|TR0|Tucson college as a "genocide 
20110118140322.108|20110118140324.046|TR0|school."

20110118140331.795|20110118140333.732|TR0|school. This is Pima Community 
20110118140333.732|20110118140335.670|TR0|College, one of the biggest

20110118140341.482|20110118140343.419|TR0|is genocide in America. Thank 
20110118140343.419|20110118140345.356|TR0|you. This is Jared, from Pima 
20110118140345.356|20110118140347.294|TR0|College."

20110118140412.479|20110118140414.416|TR0|Washington Post meanwhile is

20110118140416.354|20110118140418.291|TR0|her seat under a longtime

20110118140443.476|20110118140445.413|TR0|
20110118140445.413|20110118140447.351|TR0|A victim wounded in the Arizona 
20110118140447.351|20110118140449.288|TR0|shooting was arrested this 
20110118140449.288|20110118140451.225|TR0|weekend for threatening a Tea 
20110118140451.225|20110118140453.163|TR0|Party spokesperson. The victim, 
20110118140453.163|20110118140455.100|TR0|James Eric Fuller, was arrested 
20110118140455.100|20110118140457.037|TR0|for allegedly photographing 
20110118140457.037|20110118140458.975|TR0|Trent Humphries and shouting, 
20110118140458.975|20110118140500.912|TR0|"You're dead." The outburst came 
20110118140500.912|20110118140502.849|TR0|at a town hall meeting in Tucson 
20110118140502.849|20110118140504.787|TR0|where Humphries had said any 
20110118140504.787|20110118140506.724|TR0|debate over gun control should 
20110118140506.724|20110118140508.661|TR0|wait until after the slain 
20110118140508.661|20110118140510.599|TR0|victims' funerals. A 63-year-old 
20110118140510.599|20110118140512.536|TR0|disabled veteran, Fuller was 
20110118140512.536|20110118140514.473|TR0|shot in the knee and back during 
20110118140514.473|20110118140516.411|TR0|the shooting. In a Democracy 
20110118140516.411|20110118140518.348|TR0|Now! interview one day before 
20110118140518.348|20110118140520.285|TR0|his arrest, Fuller said 
20110118140520.285|20110118140522.223|TR0|right-wing opposition to gun 
20110118140522.223|20110118140524.160|TR0|control enabled the Arizona 
20110118140524.160|20110118140526.097|TR0|attack.

20110118140606.781|20110118140608.719|TR0|
20110118140608.719|20110118140610.656|TR0|On Capitol Hill, Republicans are 
20110118140610.656|20110118140612.593|TR0|moving ahead with their effort 
20110118140612.593|20110118140614.531|TR0|to repeal last year's healthcare 
20110118140614.531|20110118140616.468|TR0|law. The measure will come to 
20110118140616.468|20110118140618.405|TR0|the House floor today followed 
20110118140618.405|20110118140620.343|TR0|by a vote on Wednesday. 
20110118140620.343|20110118140622.280|TR0|Democrats have already vowed to 
20110118140622.280|20110118140624.217|TR0|block its advancement in the 
20110118140624.217|20110118140626.154|TR0|Senate. On the eve of the

20110118140628.092|20110118140630.029|TR0|shows public support for 
20110118140630.029|20110118140631.966|TR0|repealing the healthcare law has 
20110118140631.966|20110118140633.904|TR0|plunged over the past week.

20110118140639.716|20110118140641.653|TR0|Poll: Support for Healthcare 
20110118140641.653|20110118140643.590|TR0|Repeal Drops
20110118140643.590|20110118140645.528|TR0|
20110118140645.528|20110118140647.465|TR0|According to the Associated 
20110118140647.465|20110118140649.402|TR0|Press, just 30 percent of 
20110118140649.402|20110118140651.340|TR0|Americans say they strongly 
20110118140651.340|20110118140653.277|TR0|oppose the healthcare law, and 
20110118140653.277|20110118140655.214|TR0|only one in four back a full 
20110118140655.214|20110118140657.152|TR0|repeal. A poll earlier this 
20110118140657.152|20110118140659.089|TR0|month showed that a majority 
20110118140659.089|20110118140701.026|TR0|supported repealing Obama's 
20110118140701.026|20110118140702.964|TR0|healthcare by a margin of 46 to 
20110118140702.964|20110118140704.901|TR0|40 percent.

20110118140708.776|20110118140710.713|TR0|
20110118140710.713|20110118140712.650|TR0|Study: 129 Million Americans 
20110118140712.650|20110118140714.588|TR0|Suffer Pre-Existing Medical 
20110118140714.588|20110118140716.525|TR0|Conditions
20110118140716.525|20110118140718.462|TR0|
20110118140718.462|20110118140720.400|TR0|Among the healthcare law's most 
20110118140720.400|20110118140722.337|TR0|popular features is a provision 
20110118140722.337|20110118140724.274|TR0|barring insurance companies from 
20110118140724.274|20110118140726.212|TR0|rejecting people with 
20110118140726.212|20110118140728.149|TR0|pre-existing medical conditions. 
20110118140728.149|20110118140730.086|TR0|A new government study out today 
20110118140730.086|20110118140732.024|TR0|estimates that as many 129 
20110118140732.024|20110118140733.961|TR0|million Americans under the age 
20110118140733.961|20110118140735.898|TR0|of 65 have medical conditions 
20110118140735.898|20110118140737.836|TR0|that would trigger either 
20110118140737.836|20110118140739.773|TR0|rejections or price hikes from 
20110118140739.773|20110118140741.710|TR0|insurance companies. According 
20110118140741.710|20110118140743.648|TR0|to the study, one-fifth to 
20110118140743.648|20110118140745.585|TR0|one-half of the non-elderly in 
20110118140745.585|20110118140747.522|TR0|the United States have ailments 
20110118140747.522|20110118140749.460|TR0|that would limit their ability 
20110118140749.460|20110118140751.397|TR0|to obtain insurance if the law 
20110118140751.397|20110118140753.334|TR0|is repealed. The provision is 
20110118140753.334|20110118140755.272|TR0|set to take effect in 2014; a 
20110118140755.272|20110118140757.209|TR0|measure barring the rejection of 
20110118140757.209|20110118140759.146|TR0|insurance to children with 
20110118140759.146|20110118140801.084|TR0|pre-existing conditions came 
20110118140801.084|20110118140803.021|TR0|into effect last year.
20110118140803.021|20110118140804.958|TR0|

20110118140806.896|20110118140808.833|TR0|
20110118140808.833|20110118140810.770|TR0|56 Killed in Iraq Suicide Bombing
20110118140810.770|20110118140812.708|TR0|
20110118140812.708|20110118140814.645|TR0|At least 60 people have been 
20110118140814.645|20110118140816.582|TR0|killed and another 150 wounded 
20110118140816.582|20110118140818.520|TR0|in a suicide attack in the 
20110118140818.520|20110118140820.457|TR0|northern Iraqi city of Tikrit. 
20110118140820.457|20110118140822.394|TR0|The bomber reportedly detonated 
20110118140822.394|20110118140824.332|TR0|an explosive vest in a line of 
20110118140824.332|20110118140826.269|TR0|people applying for jobs with 
20110118140826.269|20110118140828.206|TR0|the police. It was the deadliest 
20110118140828.206|20110118140830.143|TR0|incident in Iraq since October 
20110118140830.143|20110118140832.081|TR0|31, when a siege at a Baghdad 
20110118140832.081|20110118140834.018|TR0|church killed at least 53 
20110118140834.018|20110118140835.955|TR0|people. Meanwhile, three U.S. 
20110118140835.955|20110118140837.893|TR0|soldiers were killed in Iraq on 
20110118140837.893|20110118140839.830|TR0|Saturday, making it one of the 
20110118140839.830|20110118140841.767|TR0|deadliest days for U.S. forces 
20110118140841.767|20110118140843.705|TR0|there in months. This weekend 
20110118140843.705|20110118140845.642|TR0|also marked the 20th anniversary 
20110118140845.642|20110118140847.579|TR0|of the first U.S. attack on Iraq 
20110118140847.579|20110118140849.517|TR0|in what the military named 
20110118140849.517|20110118140851.454|TR0|Operation Desert Storm. 
20110118140851.454|20110118140853.391|TR0|Estimates of the Iraqi dead 
20110118140853.391|20110118140855.329|TR0|reach as high as 3,600 civilians 
20110118140855.329|20110118140857.266|TR0|and some 35,000 soldiers.

20110118140906.953|20110118140908.890|TR0|
20110118140908.890|20110118140910.827|TR0|Election monitors in Sudan are 
20110118140910.827|20110118140912.765|TR0|predicting residents of Southern 
20110118140912.765|20110118140914.702|TR0|Sudan have overwhelmingly voted 
20110118140914.702|20110118140916.639|TR0|to break off from the north in a 
20110118140916.639|20110118140918.577|TR0|week-long referendum. The chair 
20110118140918.577|20110118140920.514|TR0|of the Southern Sudan Referendum 
20110118140920.514|20110118140922.451|TR0|Commission, Mohamed Ibrahim 
20110118140922.451|20110118140924.389|TR0|Khalil, praised the vote.
20110118140924.389|20110118140926.326|TR0|
20110118140926.326|20110118140928.263|TR0|Mohamed Ibrahim Khalil: "It was 
20110118140928.263|20110118140930.201|TR0|a very orderly process, very 
20110118140930.201|20110118140932.138|TR0|peaceful, very civilized. As a 
20110118140932.138|20110118140934.075|TR0|matter of fact, as a matter of

20110118141053.506|20110118141055.443|TR0|
20110118141055.443|20110118141057.380|TR0|Former Haitian dictator 
20110118141057.380|20110118141059.318|TR0|Jean-Claude Duvalier has 
20110118141059.318|20110118141101.255|TR0|returned to Haiti 25 years after 
20110118141101.255|20110118141103.192|TR0|a popular uprising forced him 
20110118141103.192|20110118141105.130|TR0|into exile. Known as "Baby Doc," 
20110118141105.130|20110118141107.067|TR0|Duvalier succeeded his father, 
20110118141107.067|20110118141109.004|TR0|Francois Duvalier, following the 
20110118141109.004|20110118141110.942|TR0|elder Duvalier's death in 1971. 
20110118141110.942|20110118141112.879|TR0|Jean-Claude Duvalier oversaw the 
20110118141112.879|20110118141114.816|TR0|killings and torture of 
20110118141114.816|20110118141116.754|TR0|thousands of people, mostly at 
20110118141116.754|20110118141118.691|TR0|the hands of the militia known 
20110118141118.691|20110118141120.628|TR0|as the Tonton Macoutes. In a 
20110118141120.628|20110118141122.566|TR0|surprise return from exile in 
20110118141122.566|20110118141124.503|TR0|France, Duvalier said he had 
20110118141124.503|20110118141126.440|TR0|come back to assist Haiti's 
20110118141126.440|20110118141128.378|TR0|"re-birth" in the aftermath of 
20110118141128.378|20110118141130.315|TR0|last year's earthquake. Javier 
20110118141130.315|20110118141132.252|TR0|Zuniga of Amnesty International 
20110118141132.252|20110118141134.190|TR0|called on the Haitian government 
20110118141134.190|20110118141136.127|TR0|to prosecute Duvalier.
20110118141136.127|20110118141138.064|TR0|
20110118141138.064|20110118141140.002|TR0|Javier Zuniga: "We are asking 
20110118141140.002|20110118141141.939|TR0|for him to be arrested and to be 
20110118141141.939|20110118141143.876|TR0|put forward a trial, because 
20110118141143.876|20110118141145.814|TR0|during his time extrajudicial 
20110118141145.814|20110118141147.751|TR0|executions, disappearances and 
20110118141147.751|20110118141149.688|TR0|systematic torture was just the 
20110118141149.688|20110118141151.626|TR0|mark of his regime. The time of 
20110118141151.626|20110118141153.563|TR0|the Duvaliers, it was lost years 
20110118141153.563|20110118141155.500|TR0|for Haiti's development, for 
20110118141155.500|20110118141157.438|TR0|Haiti's human rights progress, 
20110118141157.438|20110118141159.375|TR0|and therefore if something - the 
20110118141159.375|20110118141201.312|TR0|weakness of the state in Haiti 
20110118141201.312|20110118141203.250|TR0|right now comes from that time, 
20110118141203.250|20110118141205.187|TR0|and I think he's also 
20110118141205.187|20110118141207.124|TR0|responsible for that."

20110118141844.276|20110118141846.214|TR0|'Bradley Manning is showing us 
20110118141846.214|20110118141848.151|TR0|what we're doing. We need to 
20110118141848.151|20110118141850.088|TR0|rejudge our policy, rethink our 
20110118141850.088|20110118141852.026|TR0|foreign policy. We need to move 
20110118141852.026|20110118141853.963|TR0|to become a country that obeys 
20110118141853.963|20110118141855.900|TR0|the law, not one that violates 
20110118141855.900|20110118141857.838|TR0|the law.' Bradley Manning has 
20110118141857.838|20110118141859.775|TR0|provided the American people an 
20110118141859.775|20110118141901.712|TR0|opportunity to know what their 
20110118141901.712|20110118141903.650|TR0|country is doing."
20110118141903.650|20110118141905.587|TR0|

20110118141934.647|20110118141936.584|TR0|Following Snub
20110118141936.584|20110118141938.522|TR0|
20110118141938.522|20110118141940.459|TR0|Meanwhile, in Maine, Republican 
20110118141940.459|20110118141942.396|TR0|Governor Paul LePage is under 
20110118141942.396|20110118141944.334|TR0|criticism for his handling of a 
20110118141944.334|20110118141946.271|TR0|Martin Luther King Day event 
20110118141946.271|20110118141948.208|TR0|invitation from the NAACP. 
20110118141948.208|20110118141950.146|TR0|LePage initially turned the 
20110118141950.146|20110118141952.083|TR0|invitation down, upsetting the 
20110118141952.083|20110118141954.020|TR0|group. But LePage drew even more 
20110118141954.020|20110118141955.958|TR0|controversy when he offered this 
20110118141955.958|20110118141957.895|TR0|response to the NAACP's reaction.
20110118141957.895|20110118141959.832|TR0|

20110118142001.770|20110118142003.707|TR0|kiss my butt. If they want to 
20110118142003.707|20110118142005.644|TR0|play the race card, come to 
20110118142005.644|20110118142007.582|TR0|dinner, and my son will talk to 
20110118142007.582|20110118142009.519|TR0|them."

20110118142025.018|20110118142026.955|TR0|
20110118142026.955|20110118142028.892|TR0|Wisconsin Republican Party chair 
20110118142028.892|20110118142030.830|TR0|Reince Priebus has been elected 
20110118142030.830|20110118142032.767|TR0|the new head of the Republican 
20110118142032.767|20110118142034.704|TR0|National Committee. Priebus 
20110118142034.704|20110118142036.641|TR0|replaces Michael Steele, who 
20110118142036.641|20110118142038.579|TR0|aborted his bid for a second 
20110118142038.579|20110118142040.516|TR0|term after falling behind in 
20110118142040.516|20110118142042.453|TR0|early voting last week. Priebus 
20110118142042.453|20110118142044.391|TR0|has set a fundraising goal of 
20110118142044.391|20110118142046.328|TR0|$400 million in the next two 
20110118142046.328|20110118142048.265|TR0|years.
20110118142048.265|20110118142050.203|TR0|
20110118142050.203|20110118142052.140|SEG|Type=Headline
20110118142052.140|20110118142054.077|TR0|
20110118142054.077|20110118142056.015|TR0|Independent Journalist, Activist 
20110118142056.015|20110118142057.952|TR0|John Ross Dies
20110118142057.952|20110118142059.889|TR0|
20110118142059.889|20110118142101.827|TR0|And the independent journalist, 
20110118142101.827|20110118142103.764|TR0|activist and poet John Ross has 
20110118142103.764|20110118142105.701|TR0|died. Ross covered social 
20110118142105.701|20110118142107.639|TR0|movements in Mexico and Latin 
20110118142107.639|20110118142109.576|TR0|America for nearly 50 years. He 
20110118142109.576|20110118142111.513|TR0|authored 10 books, including his 
20110118142111.513|20110118142113.451|TR0|latest El Monstruo: Dread and 
20110118142113.451|20110118142115.388|TR0|Redemption in Mexico City. In a 
20110118142115.388|20110118142117.325|TR0|Democracy Now! interview last 
20110118142117.325|20110118142119.263|TR0|April, Ross talked about how he 
20110118142119.263|20110118142121.200|TR0|first came to the Mexican 
20110118142121.200|20110118142123.137|TR0|capital.
20110118142123.137|20110118142125.075|TR0|
20110118142125.075|20110118142127.012|TR0|John Ross: "I went to Mexico in 
20110118142127.012|20110118142128.949|TR0|1957 with a number of younger 
20110118142128.949|20110118142130.887|TR0|Beat poets. We were much younger 
20110118142130.887|20110118142132.824|TR0|than the Jack Kerouacs and Allen 
20110118142132.824|20110118142134.761|TR0|Ginsbergs. We were about 15 -- 
20110118142134.761|20110118142136.699|TR0|well, not so much younger than 
20110118142136.699|20110118142138.636|TR0|Allen, but certainly than 
20110118142138.636|20110118142140.573|TR0|Kerouac and Burroughs. We were 
20110118142140.573|20110118142142.511|TR0|about 15 years younger. But we 
20110118142142.511|20110118142144.448|TR0|had contact with them in New 
20110118142144.448|20110118142146.385|TR0|York. I come from the Village. I 
20110118142146.385|20110118142148.323|TR0|was born in the Village, and my 
20110118142148.323|20110118142150.260|TR0|contact was always with poets 
20110118142150.260|20110118142152.197|TR0|and artists, and came to Mexico 
20110118142152.197|20110118142154.135|TR0|in 1957, returned in 1958. And I 
20110118142154.135|20110118142156.072|TR0|didn't go on the road. I mean, 
20110118142156.072|20110118142158.009|TR0|all the Beats were always on the 
20110118142158.009|20110118142159.947|TR0|road. I came and stayed. And I 
20110118142159.947|20110118142201.884|TR0|lived for seven years in a small 
20110118142201.884|20110118142203.821|TR0|indigenous village in the 
20110118142203.821|20110118142205.759|TR0|mountains of Michuacan. And 
20110118142205.759|20110118142207.696|TR0|truly, you know, I've been very 
20110118142207.696|20110118142209.633|TR0|close to the Zapatista movement 
20110118142209.633|20110118142211.571|TR0|during the last 16 years. And I 
20110118142211.571|20110118142213.508|TR0|could have not been close to the 
20110118142213.508|20110118142215.445|TR0|Zapatista movement, if I hadn't 
20110118142215.445|20110118142217.383|TR0|spent so many years living in an 
20110118142217.383|20110118142219.320|TR0|indigenous community and 
20110118142219.320|20110118142221.257|TR0|understanding the dynamic of 
20110118142221.257|20110118142223.195|TR0|indigenous life in rural Mexico."
20110118142223.195|20110118142225.132|TR0|
20110118142225.132|20110118142227.069|SEG|Type=Story
20110118142227.069|20110118142229.007|TR0|
20110118142229.007|20110118142230.944|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: Tunisia has 
20110118142230.944|20110118142232.881|TR0|announced an interim national 
20110118142232.881|20110118142234.818|TR0|unity government days after a 
20110118142234.818|20110118142236.756|TR0|popular revolt ousted the 
20110118142236.756|20110118142238.693|TR0|president from power in the 
20110118142238.693|20110118142240.630|TR0|first Middle East revolution in 
20110118142240.630|20110118142242.568|TR0|a generation.
20110118142242.568|20110118142244.505|TR0|
20110118142244.505|20110118142246.442|TR0|In a dramatic turn of events, 
20110118142246.442|20110118142248.380|TR0|President Zine El Abidine Ben 
20110118142248.380|20110118142250.317|TR0|Ali fled Tunisia Friday after a 
20110118142250.317|20110118142252.254|TR0|month of unprecedented protests 
20110118142252.254|20110118142254.192|TR0|gripped the country. Thousands 
20110118142254.192|20110118142256.129|TR0|took to the streets to 
20110118142256.129|20110118142258.066|TR0|demonstrate against 
20110118142258.066|20110118142300.004|TR0|unemployment, high food prices, 
20110118142300.004|20110118142301.941|TR0|corruption and government 
20110118142301.941|20110118142303.878|TR0|repression. At least 80 people 
20110118142303.878|20110118142305.816|TR0|were killed in a crackdown by 
20110118142305.816|20110118142307.753|TR0|government security forces.
20110118142307.753|20110118142309.690|TR0|
20110118142309.690|20110118142311.628|TR0|As the protests spread to the 
20110118142311.628|20110118142313.565|TR0|capital, Tunis, Ben Ali fled the 
20110118142313.565|20110118142315.502|TR0|country and sought refuge in 
20110118142315.502|20110118142317.440|TR0|Saudi Arabia. He had been in 
20110118142317.440|20110118142319.377|TR0|office for 23 years and was only 
20110118142319.377|20110118142321.314|TR0|Tunisia's second president since 
20110118142321.314|20110118142323.252|TR0|independence from France in 1956.
20110118142323.252|20110118142325.189|TR0|
20110118142325.189|20110118142327.126|TR0|On Monday, the Tunisian prime 
20110118142327.126|20110118142329.064|TR0|minister, Mohamed Ghannouchi, 
20110118142329.064|20110118142331.001|TR0|announced that members of 
20110118142331.001|20110118142332.938|TR0|opposition parties will take up 
20110118142332.938|20110118142334.876|TR0|places in the government for the 
20110118142334.876|20110118142336.813|TR0|first time. But key figures of 
20110118142336.813|20110118142338.750|TR0|the old guard - including the 
20110118142338.750|20110118142340.688|TR0|former defense, foreign, 
20110118142340.688|20110118142342.625|TR0|interior and finance ministers - 
20110118142342.625|20110118142344.562|TR0|will keep their key posts in the 
20110118142344.562|20110118142346.500|TR0|new government. Up to a thousand 
20110118142346.500|20110118142348.437|TR0|protesters took to the streets 
20110118142348.437|20110118142350.374|TR0|today in protest and called on 
20110118142350.374|20110118142352.312|TR0|all members of the Ben Ali 
20110118142352.312|20110118142354.249|TR0|government to be excluded in the 
20110118142354.249|20110118142356.186|TR0|new coalition.
20110118142356.186|20110118142358.124|TR0|
20110118142358.124|20110118142400.061|TR0|In a news conference on Monday, 
20110118142400.061|20110118142401.998|TR0|Ghannouchi announced the unity 
20110118142401.998|20110118142403.936|TR0|government would begin the 
20110118142403.936|20110118142405.873|TR0|transformation of Tunisia's 
20110118142405.873|20110118142407.810|TR0|political system.
20110118142407.810|20110118142409.748|TR0|
20110118142409.748|20110118142411.685|TR0|>> PRIME MINISTER MOHAMED 
20110118142411.685|20110118142413.622|TR0|GHANNOUCHI: [translated] The 
20110118142413.622|20110118142415.560|TR0|government pledges to open a 
20110118142415.560|20110118142417.497|TR0|dialogue with all elements of 
20110118142417.497|20110118142419.434|TR0|civil and political society and 
20110118142419.434|20110118142421.372|TR0|to allow free expression and 
20110118142421.372|20110118142423.309|TR0|activity. It also pledges to 
20110118142423.309|20110118142425.246|TR0|accelerate efforts to restore 
20110118142425.246|20110118142427.184|TR0|tranquility to all Tunisians and 
20110118142427.184|20110118142429.121|TR0|to work for restoration of 
20110118142429.121|20110118142431.058|TR0|security as soon as possible. It 
20110118142431.058|20110118142432.996|TR0|also undertakes to concentrate 
20110118142432.996|20110118142434.933|TR0|efforts to move development 
20110118142434.933|20110118142436.870|TR0|forward, create jobs, and 
20110118142436.870|20110118142438.807|TR0|improve life conditions 
20110118142438.807|20110118142440.745|TR0|everywhere.
20110118142440.745|20110118142442.682|TR0|
20110118142442.682|20110118142444.619|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: Ghannouchi said 
20110118142444.619|20110118142446.557|TR0|elections would be held within 
20110118142446.557|20110118142448.494|TR0|60 days, controlled by an 
20110118142448.494|20110118142450.431|TR0|independent election commission 
20110118142450.431|20110118142452.369|TR0|and monitored by international 
20110118142452.369|20110118142454.306|TR0|observers. The prime minister 
20110118142454.306|20110118142456.243|TR0|also said a ban on the 
20110118142456.243|20110118142458.181|TR0|activities of human rights 
20110118142458.181|20110118142500.118|TR0|groups in Tunisia will be lifted 
20110118142500.118|20110118142502.055|TR0|and that all political prisoners 
20110118142502.055|20110118142503.993|TR0|would be freed. The new 
20110118142503.993|20110118142505.930|TR0|government also created a 
20110118142505.930|20110118142507.867|TR0|commission to investigate 
20110118142507.867|20110118142509.805|TR0|corruption amidst reports that 
20110118142509.805|20110118142511.742|TR0|President Ben Ali's wife had 
20110118142511.742|20110118142513.679|TR0|spirited away one-and-a-half 
20110118142513.679|20110118142515.617|TR0|tons of gold out of the country 
20110118142515.617|20110118142517.554|TR0|last month.
20110118142517.554|20110118142519.491|TR0|
20110118142519.491|20110118142521.429|TR0|U.N. Secretary-General Ban 
20110118142521.429|20110118142523.366|TR0|Ki-moon said Monday he is 
20110118142523.366|20110118142525.303|TR0|encouraged by developments in 
20110118142525.303|20110118142527.241|TR0|Tunisia and called for the 
20110118142527.241|20110118142529.178|TR0|establishment of the rule of law.
20110118142529.178|20110118142531.115|TR0|
20110118142531.115|20110118142533.053|TR0|>> SECRETARY-GENERAL BAN 
20110118142533.053|20110118142534.990|TR0|KI-MOON: While I feel encouraged 
20110118142534.990|20110118142536.927|TR0|by the ongoing dialogue between 
20110118142536.927|20110118142538.865|TR0|the caretaker government and the 
20110118142538.865|20110118142540.802|TR0|large array of political parties 
20110118142540.802|20110118142542.739|TR0|and civil society organizations, 
20110118142542.739|20110118142544.677|TR0|I remain extremely concerned 
20110118142544.677|20110118142546.614|TR0|about the continued violence and 
20110118142546.614|20110118142548.551|TR0|resulting loss of lives and 
20110118142548.551|20110118142550.489|TR0|property. I urge all concerned 
20110118142550.489|20110118142552.426|TR0|parties to ensure an immediate 
20110118142552.426|20110118142554.363|TR0|end to the violence. This is a 
20110118142554.363|20110118142556.301|TR0|moment for the Tunisian people 
20110118142556.301|20110118142558.238|TR0|to strengthen the country's 
20110118142558.238|20110118142600.175|TR0|longstanding culture of 
20110118142600.175|20110118142602.113|TR0|political moderation and its 
20110118142602.113|20110118142604.050|TR0|attachment to peace. I call on 
20110118142604.050|20110118142605.987|TR0|the government and all 
20110118142605.987|20110118142607.925|TR0|stakeholders to ensure a prompt 
20110118142607.925|20110118142609.862|TR0|restoration of the rule of law 
20110118142609.862|20110118142611.799|TR0|and to respect and accommodate 
20110118142611.799|20110118142613.737|TR0|the aspirations of the people.
20110118142613.737|20110118142615.674|TR0|
20110118142615.674|20110118142617.611|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: The protests 
20110118142617.611|20110118142619.549|TR0|that led to the overthrow of 
20110118142619.549|20110118142621.486|TR0|President Ben Ali gained 
20110118142621.486|20110118142623.423|TR0|momentum in December after 
20110118142623.423|20110118142625.361|TR0|Mohamed Bouazizi, a 26-year-old 
20110118142625.361|20110118142627.298|TR0|unemployed university graduate, 
20110118142627.298|20110118142629.235|TR0|set himself on fire after police 
20110118142629.235|20110118142631.173|TR0|seized his grocery cart, saying 
20110118142631.173|20110118142633.110|TR0|he was selling without a permit. 
20110118142633.110|20110118142635.047|TR0|He died in early January and 
20110118142635.047|20110118142636.984|TR0|quickly became a martyr to the 
20110118142636.984|20110118142638.922|TR0|unemployed protesting against 
20110118142638.922|20110118142640.859|TR0|poor living conditions. The 
20110118142640.859|20110118142642.796|TR0|self-immolation has led to 
20110118142642.796|20110118142644.734|TR0|apparent copycat protests in 
20110118142644.734|20110118142646.671|TR0|other North African states, with 
20110118142646.671|20110118142648.608|TR0|four men setting themselves on 
20110118142648.608|20110118142650.546|TR0|fire in Algeria, one each in 
20110118142650.546|20110118142652.483|TR0|Egypt and Mauritania.
20110118142652.483|20110118142654.420|TR0|
20110118142654.420|20110118142656.358|TR0|We'll start today by going to 
20110118142656.358|20110118142658.295|TR0|Tunis to speak with Fares 
20110118142658.295|20110118142700.232|TR0|Mabrouk, a Tunisian activist who 
20110118142700.232|20110118142702.170|TR0|just has returned to Tunisia, 
20110118142702.170|20110118142704.107|TR0|after about a week or a few days 
20110118142704.107|20110118142706.044|TR0|in Paris, on Sunday.
20110118142706.044|20110118142707.982|TR0|
20110118142707.982|20110118142709.919|TR0|We welcome you to Democracy Now! 
20110118142709.919|20110118142711.856|TR0|For viewers and listeners around 
20110118142711.856|20110118142713.794|TR0|the world who are trying to get 
20110118142713.794|20110118142715.731|TR0|information, if you could just 
20110118142715.731|20110118142717.668|TR0|lay the groundwork. How did this 
20110118142717.668|20110118142719.606|TR0|revolution take place? How did 
20110118142719.606|20110118142721.543|TR0|this overthrow happen, Fares?
20110118142721.543|20110118142723.480|TR0|
20110118142723.480|20110118142725.418|TR0|>> FARES MABROUK: Thank you, Amy.
20110118142725.418|20110118142727.355|TR0|
20110118142727.355|20110118142729.292|TR0|Yes, so first of all, this began 
20110118142729.292|20110118142731.230|TR0|by the suicide of Mohamed 
20110118142731.230|20110118142733.167|TR0|Bouazizi. And then hundreds and 
20110118142733.167|20110118142735.104|TR0|thousands of Tunisians opened - 
20110118142735.104|20110118142737.042|TR0|I mean, put their family, their 
20110118142737.042|20110118142738.979|TR0|life, their jobs on standby and 
20110118142738.979|20110118142740.916|TR0|joined this movement. And the 
20110118142740.916|20110118142742.854|TR0|internet and Facebook and 
20110118142742.854|20110118142744.791|TR0|Twitter played a major role in 
20110118142744.791|20110118142746.728|TR0|spreading the information and 
20110118142746.728|20110118142748.666|TR0|organizing the revolution, 
20110118142748.666|20110118142750.603|TR0|because now it's a revolution, 
20110118142750.603|20110118142752.540|TR0|it's not a revolt.
20110118142752.540|20110118142754.478|TR0|
20110118142754.478|20110118142756.415|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: And explain 
20110118142756.415|20110118142758.352|TR0|about the self-immolation. The

20110118144551.632|20110118144553.569|TR0|>> JUAN COLE: Well, this is the 
20110118144553.569|20110118144555.507|TR0|first popular revolution since 
20110118144555.507|20110118144557.444|TR0|1979. But it's distinctive in 
20110118144557.444|20110118144559.381|TR0|that the Iranian Revolution in 
20110118144559.381|20110118144601.319|TR0|1979 was ultimately taken over 
20110118144601.319|20110118144603.256|TR0|by the ayatollahs, by a clerical 
20110118144603.256|20110118144605.193|TR0|elite, and so it didn't develop 
20110118144605.193|20110118144607.131|TR0|in a democratic direction, 
20110118144607.131|20110118144609.068|TR0|whereas this revolution so far 
20110118144609.068|20110118144611.005|TR0|has been spearheaded by labor 
20110118144611.005|20110118144612.943|TR0|movements, by internet 
20110118144612.943|20110118144614.880|TR0|activists, by rural workers. 
20110118144614.880|20110118144616.817|TR0|It's a populist revolution, and 
20110118144616.817|20110118144618.755|TR0|not particularly dominated in 
20110118144618.755|20110118144620.692|TR0|any way by Islamic themes, it 
20110118144620.692|20110118144622.629|TR0|seems to be a largely secular 
20110118144622.629|20110118144624.567|TR0|development. And it's occurring 
20110118144624.567|20110118144626.504|TR0|in a Sunni and an Arab country, 
20110118144626.504|20110118144628.441|TR0|unlike Iran, which is Persian 
20110118144628.441|20110118144630.379|TR0|and Shiite. And it's occurring 
20110118144630.379|20110118144632.316|TR0|in a country that has many 
20110118144632.316|20110118144634.253|TR0|similarities to other countries 
20110118144634.253|20110118144636.191|TR0|living under authoritarian 
20110118144636.191|20110118144638.128|TR0|regimes with limited employment 
20110118144638.128|20110118144640.065|TR0|opportunities and a kind of 
20110118144640.065|20110118144642.003|TR0|long-term economic stagnation. 
20110118144642.003|20110118144643.940|TR0|So, it's something that other 
20110118144643.940|20110118144645.877|TR0|Arab countries might well look 
20110118144645.877|20110118144647.814|TR0|to - the publics, at least - for 
20110118144647.814|20110118144649.752|TR0|inspiration.
20110118144649.752|20110118144651.689|TR0|

20110118145328.841|20110118145330.779|TR0|unemployed. There's extreme

20110118145503.770|20110118145505.708|TR0|Anthony, talk, from your

20110118145507.645|20110118145509.582|TR0|significance of the Tunisian 
20110118145509.582|20110118145511.520|TR0|revolution, especially as 
20110118145511.520|20110118145513.457|TR0|Lebanon's national unity 
20110118145513.457|20110118145515.394|TR0|government collapsed last week, 
20110118145515.394|20110118145517.332|TR0|and what the means for Lebanon.
20110118145517.332|20110118145519.269|TR0|
20110118145519.269|20110118145521.206|TR0|>> ANTHONY SHADID: Well, you 
20110118145521.206|20110118145523.144|TR0|know, what struck me, Amy, was 
20110118145523.144|20110118145525.081|TR0|how electric of a moment it 
20110118145525.081|20110118145527.018|TR0|actually was in the Middle East. 
20110118145527.018|20110118145528.956|TR0|I mean, it's not an 
20110118145528.956|20110118145530.893|TR0|overstatement to say that every 
20110118145530.893|20110118145532.830|TR0|conversation that you heard the 
20110118145532.830|20110118145534.768|TR0|past few days was dominated by 
20110118145534.768|20110118145536.705|TR0|the events in Tunisia. And I 
20110118145536.705|20110118145538.642|TR0|think, in a way, it was almost 
20110118145538.642|20110118145540.580|TR0|an antidote to the 
20110118145540.580|20110118145542.517|TR0|demoralization we've seen in the 
20110118145542.517|20110118145544.454|TR0|region over the past few years - 
20110118145544.454|20110118145546.392|TR0|the carnage in Iraq, Israeli 
20110118145546.392|20110118145548.329|TR0|intransigence, divisions among 
20110118145548.329|20110118145550.266|TR0|Palestinians, the utter 
20110118145550.266|20110118145552.204|TR0|inability of governments in 
20110118145552.204|20110118145554.141|TR0|Egypt and Saudi Arabia to reform 
20110118145554.141|20110118145556.078|TR0|themselves. Here, for the first 
20110118145556.078|20110118145558.016|TR0|time in a long while, you saw 
20110118145558.016|20110118145559.953|TR0|this moment in Tunisia, this 
20110118145559.953|20110118145601.890|TR0|popular revolt, a revolution, 
20110118145601.890|20110118145603.828|TR0|and I think it was just 
20110118145603.828|20110118145605.765|TR0|electric. It electrified people 
20110118145605.765|20110118145607.702|TR0|across the Arab world, mainly 
20110118145607.702|20110118145609.640|TR0|for that prospect of change, 
20110118145609.640|20110118145611.577|TR0|that change can actually occur 
20110118145611.577|20110118145613.514|TR0|in a lot of countries that seem 
20110118145613.514|20110118145615.452|TR0|almost ossified at this point.
20110118145615.452|20110118145617.389|TR0|
20110118145617.389|20110118145619.326|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: And particularly 
20110118145619.326|20110118145621.264|TR0|for Lebanon, where you are, and 
20110118145621.264|20110118145623.201|TR0|what's happening there right now?
20110118145623.201|20110118145625.138|TR0|
20110118145625.138|20110118145627.076|TR0|>> ANTHONY SHADID: And I think 
20110118145627.076|20110118145629.013|TR0|Lebanon is symptomatic of that, 
20110118145629.013|20110118145630.950|TR0|kind of that demoralization. 
20110118145630.950|20110118145632.888|TR0|Again this country finds itself 
20110118145632.888|20110118145634.825|TR0|again in a crisis, basically 
20110118145634.825|20110118145636.762|TR0|another iteration of a crisis 
20110118145636.762|20110118145638.700|TR0|that's been going on for the 
20110118145638.700|20110118145640.637|TR0|past six years. There's a sense 
20110118145640.637|20110118145642.574|TR0|here that it's going to take 
20110118145642.574|20110118145644.512|TR0|violence before there's a 
20110118145644.512|20110118145646.449|TR0|resolution, and everybody is 
20110118145646.449|20110118145648.386|TR0|pretty much bracing for a few

20110118145650.324|20110118145652.261|TR0|I think Tunisia was kind of the 
20110118145652.261|20110118145654.198|TR0|bright spot. In some ways, 
20110118145654.198|20110118145656.135|TR0|Tunisia was a contrast to what 
20110118145656.135|20110118145658.073|TR0|we're seeing in Lebanon right 
20110118145658.073|20110118145700.010|TR0|now.
20110118145700.010|20110118145701.947|TR0|
20110118145701.947|20110118145703.885|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: And how the 
20110118145703.885|20110118145705.822|TR0|government now, which we are 
20110118145705.822|20110118145707.759|TR0|also not getting much 
20110118145707.759|20110118145709.697|TR0|information about, how it is 
20110118145709.697|20110118145711.634|TR0|dealing, and the situation with 
20110118145711.634|20110118145713.571|TR0|Hezbollah in Lebanon?
20110118145713.571|20110118145715.509|TR0|
20110118145715.509|20110118145717.446|TR0|>> ANTHONY SHADID: You know, 
20110118145717.446|20110118145719.383|TR0|it's again - it's a 
20110118145719.383|20110118145721.321|TR0|confrontation that divides the 
20110118145721.321|20110118145723.258|TR0|country pretty much evenly. What 
20110118145723.258|20110118145725.195|TR0|makes it so combustible, in some 
20110118145725.195|20110118145727.133|TR0|ways, is that it cuts across 
20110118145727.133|20110118145729.070|TR0|questions of sect, of ideology, 
20110118145729.070|20110118145731.007|TR0|of the conflict with Israel. On 
20110118145731.007|20110118145732.945|TR0|one side you have the government 
20110118145732.945|20110118145734.882|TR0|that is nominally supported by 
20110118145734.882|20110118145736.819|TR0|the Sunni sect in the country. 
20110118145736.819|20110118145738.757|TR0|Of course, you have Hezbollah, 
20110118145738.757|20110118145740.694|TR0|the superpower among the Shiite 
20110118145740.694|20110118145742.631|TR0|community here. So what's so 
20110118145742.631|20110118145744.569|TR0|dangerous about this conflict, 
20110118145744.569|20110118145746.506|TR0|in some ways, it's not just a 
20110118145746.506|20110118145748.443|TR0|government opposition conflict, 
20110118145748.443|20110118145750.381|TR0|it's a conflict that could 
20110118145750.381|20110118145752.318|TR0|quickly turn sectarian, that 
20110118145752.318|20110118145754.255|TR0|could turn violent. It's deeply 
20110118145754.255|20110118145756.193|TR0|ideological, as well. What we 
20110118145756.193|20110118145758.130|TR0|have is Hezbollah fearing the 
20110118145758.130|20110118145800.067|TR0|indictments that may be handed 
20110118145800.067|20110118145802.005|TR0|down by an international 
20110118145802.005|20110118145803.942|TR0|tribunal naming its members in 
20110118145803.942|20110118145805.879|TR0|the assassination of a former 
20110118145805.879|20110118145807.817|TR0|prime minister. That former 
20110118145807.817|20110118145809.754|TR0|prime minister, his son is now 
20110118145809.754|20110118145811.691|TR0|the caretaker prime minister, 
20110118145811.691|20110118145813.629|TR0|was head of the government that 
20110118145813.629|20110118145815.566|TR0|fell last week. So, what we're 
20110118145815.566|20110118145817.503|TR0|dealing with almost is a waiting 
20110118145817.503|20110118145819.441|TR0|period, waiting what's going to 
20110118145819.441|20110118145821.378|TR0|happen, if we can see regional 
20110118145821.378|20110118145823.315|TR0|mediation perhaps reach some 
20110118145823.315|20110118145825.253|TR0|kind of solution, that's not all 
20110118145825.253|20110118145827.190|TR0|that likely. If it doesn't, we 
20110118145827.190|20110118145829.127|TR0|have a stalemate. And in past 
20110118145829.127|20110118145831.065|TR0|experience in Lebanon, that 
20110118145831.065|20110118145833.002|TR0|stalemate is only broken through 
20110118145833.002|20110118145834.939|TR0|confrontation and violence.
20110118145834.939|20110118145836.877|TR0|
20110118145836.877|20110118145838.814|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: Anthony Shadid, 
20110118145838.814|20110118145840.751|TR0|I want to thank you for being 
20110118145840.751|20110118145842.689|TR0|with us, foreign correspondent 
20110118145842.689|20110118145844.626|TR0|for the New York Times. Also, 
20110118145844.626|20110118145846.563|TR0|Juan Cole, speaking to us from
